Author: ItsFlashtime#4842
Content: Is anyone really tech savy about komodo, I want to ask about interoperability questions.

Author: ItsFlashtime#4842
Content: Is cross-chain smart contracts being planned to be across sub chains of Komodo or can it be applied with other protocols such as eth for example?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: this was asked a few days ago

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: from my understanding other coins as Btc or Eth would need to implement a new transaction type for full interoperability

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: otherwise a transaction on them (but that coin must be notarized) could be used to trigger on action on a Kmd chain but not viceversa

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I hope some dev can confirm if this is correct

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: interop with existing chains would require some sort of BTC-> BTCinfo chain that is notarized to allow cross chain BTC -> KMD

Author: bogybogy#3962
Content: Good morning

Author: bogybogy#3962
Content: Gents I find something which I believe can be related well to Komodo platform and I I do any mistake pls corect me thanks

Author: bogybogy#3962
Content:
i believe that blockchains will rise and fall, and that there will be greater fragmentation before we see consolidation along vertical use case lines. And i believe that ultimately, decentralized apps will rely on the execution of multiple smart contracts, across multiple blockchains.
In short, there isn‚Äôt going to be one clear-cut ‚Äúwinning blockchain‚Äù you can select for decentralized app development. Instead,  i  believe that the best way to future-proof your investment is to take a blockchain-agnostic approach, building decentralized apps on a platform that lets you interact with any blockchain .i believe in this so firmly that komodo  platform this way: integrating with all blockchain networks, and giving you the flexibility to quickly build decentralized apps with whichever blockchain meets your needs.
When your app needs to interact with other blockchains, you already have the inbuilt capabilities to do so‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääeven in a competitive situation when you can‚Äôt be told which blockchain it is. And rather than forcing you to deal with all the different development languages, they  simplified smart contract creation so you can use natural language expressions to automatically generate code.
As your business‚Äô and industry‚Äôs use of blockchain and smart contracts evolves, you have the ability to quickly respond to changing conditions‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwhether creating new smart contracts, or interacting with entirely new blockchains.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, clearly we are headed to a future with millions of blockchains. a system that is able to manage that is needed

Author: bogybogy#3962
Content: Logical decentralization has the zero probability of system failure and can tolerate any accidental faults in the system. A attack aimed at disestablishing the system will have minimal or null effect on it. Lastly, a local system cannot act independently which also maximize the efficiency of the decentralized system as a whole.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in #ask-jl777 there is a discussion about chain independence which also relates to what you write

Content: Thanks

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Got confused this morning when I popped in and saw an error regarding hdd space (still only 10% of the drive used) and then said to update to latest or resync the chain

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: that seems to be the error telling you your db is corrupted

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: in such case just a full resync fixes the issue

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: as we re running dev branch for notary node, I think you can assume it's pretty stable. At least here I have no crashes or problem with it. Maybe someone will correct me but : master : what pools run, dev : what NN run, jl777 : experimental : used for tests and refining, for example the PoS contest that is live.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (Had that error for no reason even on dev on one of my seed node, and a rebuild with latest dev / full resync made it, in fact this error was on every single asset, just don't forget to `git checkout dev ` then `git pull` then `make clean` then `./zcutil/build.sh -jX`  (X depending on your available threads)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, beta is a much less frequently updated branch, but is ahead of master and has most of the latest
